p: Physical activity and nutrition are important lifestyle determinants for risk of disease. A high proportion of older people in both high- and low-middle income nations are sedentary [ 20]. Only a minority consume the recommended five servings a day of fruits and vegetables [ 21]. Smoking and alcohol use, and reduced cessation efforts with age, predispose to risk during epidemics [ 22]. Stress and fear associated with an epidemic compound the already high prevalence of insomnia with a variety of proposed adverse health consequences [ 23].
